comment: If you have a choice, I recommend that you choose her. If you attend class, you're likely to pass, as she provides many opportunities to ask questions and cares that you understand the material.
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures--Caring

comment: Professor Verma is always there to help you succeed. Data structures is a hard class to teach but she does an awesome job explaining in her lectures. You have 1 homework due every week that are not too hard and a lab as well. There were a few quizzes, 3 exams. She replaced the lowest grade test with a higher one. This class is crucial to learn.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Inspirational--Caring

comment: Prof. Verma is a sweetheart. She is a great teacher and is very likable. She is easy to talk to and reach out to. Her sole mission is for each of her students to leave with a thorough understanding of data structures. She doesn't care how much of her free time it takes, she will make sure you understand the concepts. The class itself is hard though
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Respected--Caring

comment: Data Structures is a tough course from content alone but Prof Verma makes it much easier. Shes very caring and helpful if you have any issues. If you read the chapters, stay on top of assignments, and participate her class can be very easy for you.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Gives good feedback--Get ready to read

comment: Caring, almost to a fault, because she REALLY wants everyone to understand the material. If you're interactive in class, you'll love her. The tests are tough, but even if you bomb them, you should pass just by doing the homework. The final is much easier than the initial tests, too. If you can't get Eyles, Verma is the next best choice IMO.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Class is tricky.. not sure how easy it is to take in class but online you are just going by the slides. Lots of assignments, but many of the answers are in the slides themselves. She is a nice teacher and very willing to help and as long as you show your efforts and that you're trying she will grade kindly.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: BEST PROFESSOR EVER! I can't rave about her enough. She is awesome awesome awesome!! She'll work with you as much as you work with her. Put in the effort and you'll get a good grade. Programming in general is a difficult concept to grasp as far as the logic goes but if you have issues understanding something go to her office hours she will help you
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: I took this class with professor Verma this semester. She is an amazing teacher and cares about her students. Her lectures were fun and the workload was appropriate. I got to learn a lot about this subject. She brought an interesting guest speaker to give us some insight into this field. Take this class if looking for an interesting elective.
rating_tags: Respected--Inspirational--Amazing lectures

comment: Super sweet and she will work with you to get the grade you want! 1301 was a lot easier to settle into because of her.

I had Professor Verma for Data Structures and she really made a difficult class much easier to handle. First test was easy, second was the hardest and the final was breeze. She also opens up HW and Lab submissions at the end of the semester in case you missed some for a large portion of partial credit. Highly recommend taking her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Caring

comment: By far the best computer science professor at KSU! If you have a choice take her. I took her for both 1301 and 1302 and her tests are easy and she grades leniently. If you don't get a good grade, do talk to her in her office hours and she will work with you to increase it.  I would highly recommend her as she is an easy A and you learn alot.
rating_tags: Respected--Amazing lectures--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Professor Verma was an excellent professor. I would recommend her to anyone taking data structures. She explains everything in detail as well as drawing it out to further explain. If you do all your work and turn it in on time and keep up with the reading you will make an A. Pseudocode is welcomed in her class on tests.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Professor Verma is fair and lays down the expectations for the class in the beginning of the semester. Expect to do your assignments, keep up with lectures and submit your work on time and you can expect a good grade. Attendance is mandatory. She also gives extra credit assignments at the end of the semester. Caring Professor.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Inspirational--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: Prof. Verma was effective when she shared how to code by actually writing and explaining code examples on the computer in lecture/lab. Her whiteboard and PowerPoint examples were confusing and didn't add any real value. CS1302 will require a lot of self study if you wish to do well. Prof. Verma does help is helpful you have questions or concerns.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Be prepared to participate in class.  Ask a lot of questions and stay on top of assignments. She is a fair professor and gives extra credit to those who put in the work. learnt a lot.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: She is a very caring teacher and will do her best to help you.  The tests are based on the book and the quizzes are based on the classwork she assigns.  She offers a lot of extra credit.
rating_tags: ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--TEST HEAVY--Caring

comment: It is Data Structure and very hard topic. All professors uses same PPT do your own studies by watching YouTube videos. Attendance 5%, First test kind of easy(study hard and make a good score) second test hard, final extremely hard(she curved it tho). Ask questions go see her in the office, show the efforts and get those partial credits.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Data Structure is hard and all the professors uses the same powerpoint to teach. She didn't curve first 2 test but she curved the final and it helped many students. Also she was nice enough to give chance to make up 2 missed assignments or labs. Be nice to her ask questions, show effort, do the work,  go see her in the office, And there is your A/B
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Here's the thing, the workload is A LOT. She is very open to answering questions and reviewing material that you don't understand in class. She does not give review material as a standard, she did give us reviews for the final and the last test though. She is very fair and will give partial credit where she can too. Be responsive and ask questions.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: In a class where you'd think there would be live coding, there isn't. She reads off of Powerpoints that are snippets taken from the textbook which you'll be reading over again regardless. Have an assignment that was turned in August? Don't expect a grade back until near the end of the semester. Never have I had such a terrible professor in my life.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Not a good professor, she is nice but she assumes you'll understand how to do the labs/homeworks/tests with the basic and awful explanations she gives.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is a great lecturer that teaches most of what we need to learn in class, and the rest can easily be found in the textbook or her PowerPoint slides. She is a nice person that cares about how her students are doing and wants them to do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She gives a good deal of homework but mostly goes over the things that you need to learn in class. The labs are pretty easy after you learn the logic behind each one. I highly recommend this teacher.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She is a sweet person, however sweetness isn't going to teach me anything. The class is frustrating, the labs/tests/quizzes and homeworks are NOTHING similar to what we "learn" in class. She teaches less than the basic concepts, sometimes she doesn't even know how to do the labs herself.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--TEST HEAVY

comment: Doesn't teach about what she assigns for work. Basically have to teach yourself
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: She does not teach the code, but just lectures about computers
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY
